summary: The Energy Savings and Weatherization Reauthorization Act of 2025 amends the Energy Conservation and Production Act to reauthorize the weatherization assistance program. Key changes include extending the reauthorization to 2030, redefining "fully weatherized," increasing the state average cost per unit for financial assistance (from $6,500 to $15,000), and allowing the Secretary to increase the assistance limit if needed. The bill makes conforming amendments to reflect these changes.
